TopicTitle: Just dropping off a crash report :)

Articles.Content:
I was just flying around in a simple craft getting the biomes around KSC. Random crash, it was my first crash on a fresh install of the game. Only mod i have is a Flag Pack...

Here is a link to the report folder...

Not much too out of the ordinary, but if it becomes a problem, you might want to check into exactly what "RivaTuner Statistics Server" is -- I'm not familiar with the software package myself, but it seems it was hooked into the process at the time of the crash, and it appeared quite high on the list of modules. In my experience, the cause of a crash typically appears within the first few modules on the list -- standard out of memory crashes usually have KSP.exe, Mono.dll, and DirectX input .dll files, whereas crashes caused by other things (AVs, or sometimes game 'optimising' applications like AMD's Raptr or NVIDIA Experience) tend to list those things first or second in the error.log file.

Good luck, and try not to kill too many kerbals out there!
"RivaTuner Statistics Server" is part of the HUD/overlay that comes with many GPU driver packages. It *shouldn't* cause any problems, but it's definitely worth trying without it.

In my experience, simply having AMD's Raptr overlay enabled on my machine causes KSP to crash instantly upon attempting to change any graphics settings. They can definitely cause problems, often quite arbitrarily.
